text: behind me is a place that could be on
the verge of solving one of the biggest
mysteries in the universe scientists
there are on the trail of one of the
most elusive particles ever known
they're called neutrinos and they're
absolutely everywhere even if I'm
speaking to you trillions of them are
streaming through me the only problem is
you can't feel them or see them and
they're incredibly difficult to study
but down there they think they've
cracked it
the walls here have been carved out of
granite and we're currently traveling
under hundreds of meters of rock and
that's really important if you want to
study tiny ghostly particles you need to
be sheltered from the constant space
weather things like cosmic rays that are
bombarding the surface of the earth
now the other thing I should tell you
while we're underground is neutrinos
don't behave like we expect them to they
do something that no other particle can
do they're constantly changing between
three very different forms swapping from
one to the other and back again and it's
this that scientists are trying to
understand here
this is the heart of the experiments
beneath these covers is a giant tank
filled with water and inside there are
the detectors and these are able to spot
the very very rare occasions that a
neutrino bumps into a regular particle
so far they've found millions of them
and it means we're finally getting close
to cracking how they work and this is
vital because neutrinos are thought to
have played an essential role in the
early universe and understanding them
could transform our understanding of the
cosmos
